talk.author: did:plc:ixtnk42h3taatavais6ystli
talk.utter: I’ve lived in California, New York, and DC. I disagree, people notice what you wear in the west, and they make a judgement. In California, it may be more casual - suits look weird - but people use clothes to signal who they are, whether it’s Boho, Goth, Punk, Professional, Farmer, etc.

talk.author: did:plc:lowflubpntz5wysgr4c2fsou
talk.utter:
Notice? Maybe. But I've been all across this great big land, and the ONLY place I've ever been where total strangers feel somehow weirdly entitled to come up to me and comment to my face on shit like that, is the eastern seaboard  

YMMV.

talk.author: did:plc:ixtnk42h3taatavais6ystli
talk.utter: Ah, I see. You’re right, people in the west don’t comment to your face about what you’re wearing. They’ll think it, they’ll tell someone else, but they won’t say it. FWIW, in NYC I’ve had it happen with food. Discussing what to get for dessert, a man said “Don’t get it here, go around the corner.”

talk.author: did:plc:ixtnk42h3taatavais6ystli
talk.utter: Ah, I see. You’re right, people in the west don’t comment to your face about what you’re wearing. They’ll think it, they’ll tell someone else, but they won’t say it. FWIW, in NYC I’ve had it happen with food. Discussing what to get for dessert, a man said “Don’t get it here, go around the corner.”

talk.author: did:plc:lowflubpntz5wysgr4c2fsou
talk.utter:
No, and some of that is just the difference in energy btw the coasts, like the old cartoon where the NYC person is saying "fuck you" and thinking "hey, nice to see you" and the LA person is saying "hey, nice to see you" and thinking "fuck you"

I couldn't live in LA either, to be honest.

talk.author: did:plc:ixtnk42h3taatavais6ystli
talk.utter: I wouldn’t live in LA. Too hard to get anywhere. Too many self-conscious people. Too much plastic surgery. I live north of LA and it’s laid back and pretty easy going.

talk.author: did:plc:ixtnk42h3taatavais6ystli
talk.utter: I wouldn’t live in LA. Too hard to get anywhere. Too many self-conscious people. Too much plastic surgery. I live north of LA and it’s laid back and pretty easy going.

talk.author: did:plc:lowflubpntz5wysgr4c2fsou
talk.utter:
An absolutely wonderful patch of Earth, no question.

Certainly when I win the powerball I will seriously consider Montecito or similar 😉👍

talk.author: did:plc:ixtnk42h3taatavais6ystli
talk.utter: I know Montecito well. As a kid, I used to play in the creeks there. I never thought about where the boulders came from. As long as you’re on a hill and not downslope from anything, it’s great, very beautiful. But you couldn’t give me a house on Olive Mill Road since January 2018.
